title: High Domestic Freshwater Usage
description: In 2021, Brunei's domestic freshwater withdrawals accounted for 164.67% of the total freshwater withdrawal, indicating a significant reliance on domestic water resources.

title: Strong National Savings
description: Brunei achieved a net national savings rate of 38.38% of GNI in 2021, showcasing its robust economic management and fiscal discipline.

title: High Government Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, 92.34% of Brunei's current health expenditure was funded by the domestic general government, reflecting a strong commitment to public health.

title: Heavy Reliance on Fuel Imports
description: By 2023, fuel imports constituted 63.76% of Brunei's merchandise imports, indicating a significant dependency on external energy sources.

title: Minimal Reliance on Personal Remittances
description: In 2023, personal remittances received accounted for only 0.006% of Brunei's GDP, indicating a low dependency on foreign income transfers.

title: Limited Use of Alternative and Nuclear Energy
description: As of 2022, alternative and nuclear energy comprised just 0.01% of Brunei's total energy use, highlighting a reliance on traditional energy sources.

title: Minimal Industrial Design Activity
description: In 2017, Brunei recorded only one industrial design application, reflecting limited innovation in this sector.

title: Low Health Expenditure
description: Brunei's current health expenditure was 1.82% of GDP in 2022, indicating a relatively low investment in healthcare.

title: Competitive Tariff Rates on Manufactured Products
description: In 2022, Brunei applied a simple mean tariff rate of 0.19% on manufactured products, showcasing a competitive trade environment.

title: Low Weighted Mean Tariff on All Products
description: Brunei's applied weighted mean tariff rate on all products was 0.01% in 2022, promoting an open market for imports.

title: Minimal Tariff on Primary Products
description: In 2021, Brunei's most favored nation weighted mean tariff on primary products was just 0.01%, encouraging raw material imports.

title: High Dependency on Manufactured Imports
description: Manufactures accounted for 27.11% of Brunei's merchandise imports in 2023, indicating a significant reliance on foreign manufactured goods.
